At LXRP, we're not just removing level crossings, but are removing barriers and creating legacies for our communities for years to come. Inclusion is a priority for us and we are committed to creating an employee community that reflects those in which we work.
We value our role as leaders to actively increase female representation in the transport sector through practical support, professional development and exposure to career opportunities.

We are proud leaders and participants of internship programs that provide opportunities to people who identify as LGBTIQ, people living with a disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, refugees or asylum seekers or people from low socioeconomic backgrounds.
We offer and encourage flexible work practices and purchased leave arrangements for all of our employees to support wellbeing, family or carer commitments or other personal circumstances.
We place great importance on growth, empowering our people to enhance their knowledge, capability and experience through continual learning, formal training and lessons learned.

Health, safety and wellbeing are at the heart of what we do. We focus on the physical, mental and emotional wellbeing of our people to create a safe and healthy workplace for everyone, every day, everywhere.

As part of a dynamic and results-driven team, you will partner with stakeholders and project teams to understand their needs to confirm scope, requirements and systems required to ensure the successful implementation of technology projects and programs within a Project Management Office.

You will have a strong sense of purpose in helping the project deliver on transforming the way Victorians live, work and travel. You are IT, business analyst, change analyst, or project management qualified, with a strong background in identifying, documenting and managing user requirements

Securities Services & Issuer Operations (SS&I Ops) has ~5,500 FTE and a budget of ~$450MM. It services multiple products, including Funds Services, Global Custody and Direct Custody and Clearing Services.

The Client Implementations organization, within SS&I Ops, has global responsibility for Client Implementations across these Securities Services products. The team is made up of program managers, project managers and implementation support team members. All three groups within the team work directly with Citi’s clients and internal partners to deliver the implementation of securities services as a solution for the clients, leveraging Citi’s products, platforms and operational teams.
As a Business Analyst, some of your responsibilities would include:
Work closely with Client Implementations Managers and PMO to develop and maintain a centralized repository of all client deals in the region
Partner with Client Implementations managers and Implementation Support Team to timely update all client deals
Analyze data from multiple source systems, find patterns and provide meaningful information to the senior management to help with decision making
Assist regional Client Implementations Head in resource tracking and planning
Assist regional Client Implementations Head and PMO in preparing monthly business reviews and ad hoc reports to senior management
Support PMO Lead to develop metrics, dashboards and project templates
Assist PMO in performing quality assurance reviews of key artefacts for large and medium deals
1-2 years relevant experience in business and data analysis
Advanced Microsoft Office Suite skills – Word, Advanced Excel, Power Point
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to perform under pressure and manage multiple tasks and priorities
Ability to function independently and with others

When you work at Citi, you will be working for an organisation that truly has a global footprint and a powerful network that spans the globe. We celebrate individual ingenuity and use the diversity of our people in order to drive high performance. Through dedicated support, training and resources, we promote our talent and future leaders to bring about lasting and positive impact. Citi Australia is an Employer of Choice for Women and supports a flexible work environment.
Personal information (as defined in the Privacy Act 1988) will be handled in accordance with our Privacy Policy. Please see www.citi.com.au/privacy
Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.

The opportunityEY DnA is the data and advanced analytics capability within EY Asia-Pacific, with over 500 specialist employees working across multiple industry sectors.

We implement information-driven strategies and systems that help grow, optimize and protect client organizations. We go beyond strategy and provide end to end implementation of real-life data environments and have some of the best architects, project managers, business analysts, data scientists, big data engineers, developers and consultants in the region.

You will be mentored and developed by a talented management team and gain exposure to a wide variety of projects that span a range of industry sectors and deliver solutions for our clients. We have a big focus on training so you will have a chance to work across new and different environments and have opportunities to be involved in real Big Data and advanced analytics related projects. You will be involved a variety of activities such as gathering technical requirements, data analysis, data profiling, ETL, data modelling, data visualisation or more across various industries and environments.

With the variety of projects we have running there is no doubt that you will be challenged and learn something new every day. As an organisation we encourage collaboration, training and personal development with dedicated budgets and career frameworks.
This is a great opportunity for someone that loves being involved in complex and challenging environments that are in need of a real solution.

Be a part of one of our successful delivery teams and get an opportunity to move into a more consultative role working across various data environments and helping our clients solve their business problems with data
Be responsible for creating requirement specifications, analysing requirements, creating visual models, facilitating elicitation sessions and digging around in the data when needed

create data design and integration flows to move the data from legacy system, add transformation logic areas and present it in the required formats through harmonized objects that can receive inputs from multiple policy and claims systems
Have knowledge and experience of all phases of software development including requirements analysis, design, coding, testing, defect management
Have experience in business intelligence, data warehousing or advanced analytics projectsSkills and attributes for success
To be successful in this role, you will have:
A degree in IT, computer science or engineering
BI reporting tools such as Tableau or Qlikview
Knowledge and experience of all phases of software development (including requirements analysis, design, coding, testing, defect management)
Exposure to business intelligence, data warehousing or advanced analytics projects
Eager to contribute in a team-oriented environment
Able to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment
Strong communicator (verbally and in writing)Ideally, you’ll also have
Experience in engaging with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Strong consulting experience and background, including engaging directly with clients
Experience in a delivery role on Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing, Big Data or analytics projects

Fixed term for 3 years Exciting opportunity for a highly organized individual to utilise their business Intelligence capability to enable data driven insights to improve processes and information transparency and support business and operational decision making within the Planning Group and Planning Industry.

The Planning Information Services Branch manages the delivery, support and enhancement of all business technology, information services and systems including spatial systems and services. The team maintains and develops information and spatial systems to enable a high level of service to support the work of the Planning Group and the wider planning industry including local government.

This Senior Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for providing specialist expertise in the development and delivery of business intelligence projects and building analytics and reporting capability. The position is responsible for designing and developing complex Tableau dashboard reports and creative visualisations of Planning data.
This will bring together data analytics across both a-spatial and spatial datasets to empower the Planning Group to work more efficiently.
A tertiary degree in a relevant discipline such as IT, Computer Science or Spatial is mandatory.
Demonstrated experience in SQL, Data Management and Data Analysis is mandatory.
Proven hands-on experience with creating data models, reports and dashboards in Tableau is highly desirable.
Experience using the ArcGIS suite of technologies is highly desirable.
Experience with FME and Python is highly desirable.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to contribute both independently and as part of a team.
This is a fixed term position available for 3 years.

To be considered for this position, your application should include a supporting statement demonstrating that you meet the key selection criteria and any job requirements specified in the position description.
DELWP will conduct relevant and required checks about applicants and the information provided with an application. Such checks will include but are not limited to:
A Statutory Declaration and Consent form consenting to DELWP contacting current and previous employer(s) to substantiate employment history, past conduct and performance is required.
A satisfactory National Police Check will be required (for all non-DELWP employees).
Applications close at midnight Tuesday 19 May 2020.

Our Business & Corporate Banking (BCB) business serves over 10,000 clients in the medium to large business segment across Australia, with complex financial needs and turnover >$10m.
We are committed to understanding our clients, and delivering insights and creative solutions, to drive sustainable business growth.

Do you want to work in a collaborative team and help to drive a market to continuing success? Are you currently writing complex credit papers and consider yourself highly skilled in cash flow analysis?

Using your strong analytical mindset, you will focus on analysing and assessing the risk and opportunities on new lending and increases in client credit. You will have the tools and infrastructure to support your team to develop new business opportunities with new and existing clients.
prepare credit submissions for new facilities, and coordination of deal execution through documentation and funding
prepare various reporting requirements such as pipeline leads, calls, contacts and revenues versus plan
complete performance monitoring and annual reviews for existing clients, and reporting of client financial and operational performance to risk management
deliver exceptional customer service in all dealings with customers and stakeholders
We want to hear from you if you:
previous experience writing and analysing credit transactions, as well as completing annual reviews and reporting, ideally within commercial and/or corporate banking
client service experience ideally in a corporate, commercial or business banking environment
highly developed financial analysis and modelling skills
the ability to quickly grasp complex transactions, and ideally have previous 'new to bank' transactional and credit risk experience.
A tertiary qualification in Business/Finance and/or Commerce would be desirable
This is an outstanding opportunity to gain exposure to sophisticated Corporate Banking clients/deals with a strong and successful business.

If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you'll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. We’re keen to support you with the next step in your career.

We're aware of some accessibility issues on this site, particularly for screen reader users. We want to make finding your dream job as easy as possible, so if you require additional support please contact HR Direct on 1800 989 696.

Work type: Fixed Term Full-timeLocation: VIC MetroCategories: Merchandise - PlannerAbout Kmart
With more than 235 stores and employing over 34,000 people, Kmart is proud to be one of Australia and New Zealand’s largest and most successful retailers.

Serving the needs of Australian and New Zealand families is at the core of who we are as a business, that’s why we are driven to be the place customers rely on for low prices and making every day living brighter.

You’ll be joining a dynamic team with a fantastic culture where diversity is openly celebrated, and you’ll be challenged and supported to achieve personal and business goals. Expect a work environment that is highly collaborative, fast-paced, inclusive and progressive - with no two days the same! Our values – Think Customer, Take Care, Live Integrity, Grow Together and Reach Higher will resonate with you deeply and you’ll enjoy being part of a growing, iconic Australian business that has a fantastic culture that is non-hierarchical, diverse and inclusive.

Reporting to the Inventory Team Leader, you will be the person replenishing and allocating merchandise to optimise service levels and inventory holdings of DC's and stores for this 12 month fixed term contract. You will be responsible for undertaking regular and proactive analysis of merchandise and store performance in order to maximise the department's financial outcomes. You will also support promotional and marketing programs with sufficient stock.

To succeed in this role you will need a sound knowledge of MS Office including Excel and Outlook mixed with excellent attention to detail and analytical skills. Thorough follow-up skills and exceptional organisational skills, with the ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines, will see you meet the challenges of this role. Retail store experience would be an advantage and an understanding of inventory management within a retail environment would also be highly regarded.

You will be afforded autonomy and accountability in your role and have access to development opportunities across both Kmart and the Wesfarmers Group, excellent remuneration, inclusion in company bonus scheme & access to Wesfarmers share plan (both for eligible team members), free parking and benefits program including a discount card for Kmart, Coles, Target and Officeworks.
At Kmart we aim to ensure our teams reflect the diversity of the communities in which we operate.
Candidates interested in this position should apply directly to this advertisement as we are not accepting applications from recruitment agencies.

The Client First Program will support the business to create a better client and employee experience for improved performance and future growth. It will identify where we need to build capability and develop the projects and initiatives we need to deliver, including how our operating model delivers better services for all our clients.

As a key member of our Client First team, you will establish and maintain the program's overall master schedule as well as risk management approach, including identification, evaluating and reporting on program's tasks, risks, dependencies whilst we're meeting our regulatory and other compliance requirements.
This role is best suited to a highly motivated and experienced Project/Program Master Scheduler with prior experience in risk analysis, in a fast-paced working environment.
Relevant tertiary qualifications or equivalent experience
Extensive experience as a Business Analyst across risk, dependency and scheduling
Significant knowledge of project planning/scheduling tools (e.g. Microsoft Project and Open Workbench), with a solid track record of practical application
Experience in setting up program schedules across multiple projects
Experience working with Project and Program Managers on large complex projects
Experience with MS Project & MS Project online, JIRA or PPM Hub, MS Office & MS Visio
Strong stakeholder management experience and negotiation skills
High degree of initiative, dependability and ability to work with little supervision
Excellent analytical, conceptual and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication, interpersonal and collaborative skills
For our clients, our people and the Victorian community, we demonstrate Care, Unity, Passion – we are here, we work together and we bring our best.

We are seeking a Physical Security Process Analyst who will work with an assigned client group to analyse business processes and procedures, identifying inefficiencies that may inhibit corporate goals.

Senior Business Analyst - WoVG API Team

The Department of Premier and Cabinet's Whole of Victorian Government Application Programming Interface Team provides API consulting services, technology and API development to support the growing demand for APIs to be used in the delivery of government services.

As Senior Business Analyst in the API Team you will work with an incredibly wide variety of Victorian Government entities to understand, document and guide their API integrations from concept through planning, design, build and implementation.

You will also play a key role in guiding and educating technical and non-technical stakeholders on the capabilities of APIs, the technology and services we provide, industry best practices, and ensure that a LEAN approach to development and solutioning is positioned at all times.

The Senior Business Analyst will be responsible for building excellent relationships with a range of technical and non-technical stakeholders to effectively design, plan and manage anywhere from ten to twenty API implementations at any time from concept through to operational handover. To do this you'll need to:
Develop a deep understanding of how the WoVG API Platform operates and serves API publishers, API consumers, developers and the general public
Work using our engagement process to elicit and convert requirements into high quality API product management documents and solution designs
Confidently use project management tools and cadences to manage the concurrent projects at varying stages with competing priorities
Take ownership of and deliver high quality project articles to maintain stakeholder confidence and ensure projects stay on-track
Confidently facilitate workshops and meetings with technical and business stakeholders including solution architects, API developers and business analysts
Implement and participate in governance processes to ensure successful reporting and delivery of projects
Maintain ongoing relationships with partners to measure outcomes and ensure API Platform integration projects are delivering the desired outcomes
Collaborate in initiatives of the Branch and other teams to ensure DDI can best deliver high quality, innovative projects to its stakeholders.
The closing date for this position is midnight, Sunday 10 May 2020.
This position is only open to applicants with relevant rights to work in Australia.
Apply before the advertised closing date, all applications should include:
a cover letter which addresses the key selection criteria (within three pages)
Preferred candidates will be required to complete a Pre-employment Declaration and Consent form. Employment of successful candidates will be subject to a National Police Check.

If you want the opportunity to shape your own career as well as the future of the financial industry, then we will give you the platform and foundation to do so. Successful interns will be invited to join the Deutsche Bank Graduate Programme. About Corporate Finance Our Corporate Finance business provides the full range of advisory and financing products and services of a leading global investment bank. Our clients include large-cap and mid-cap corporates, financial institutions, governments, government agencies and financial sponsors. We recognise that selecting the right investment banking partner can be the key to a company’s success. Our relationships are enhanced by industry sector, country and regional expertise, closely aligned to high-quality client solutions. We offer both buyside and sellside advisory services for mergers and acquisitions, restructuring advisory, debt and equity capital raising services and structured equity transactions. We are able to advise on innovative cross-border and regional transactions in the US, Europe and Asia Pacific. The role Our interns are given the opportunity to learn about our business from different viewpoints, giving you a career advantage. Working on our day-to-day business as well as on special projects, you will contribute to the innovation of new ideas to help our customers achieve their financial goals. They have degrees in many different disciplines. Even though good levels of numeracy are important for some roles, you won’t necessarily need a formal mathematical or financial background. We have very comprehensive training programmes that will give you all the technical knowledge you’ll need to build a career with us. Above all, we’re looking for entrepreneurial people who thrive best in a diverse culture where innovation and agile thinking abound. You should not only be passionate about the world of finance, but also show a keen interest in your chosen field. You already have a record of outstanding academic achievement and you’re eager to go on learning at the same intensive rate. So you’ll thrive on working in a highly collaborative environment with some of the best minds in banking. Are you passionate about finance and have an affinity for numbers?Do you have an interest in business, economics, financial mathematics or engineering, either as part of your degree or extra-curricular activities?Are you proficient in working with MS Office (eg excel) and common applications?Do you have strong communication skills and are you fluent in English?Do you have the resilience and dedication required to keep up with the pace of life in this dynamic business?Can you work well in a team and inspire others with your ideas?Would you describe yourself as a conscientious, dedicated individual with excellent analytical skills? We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. Global Investment Banking Summer Analyst Program

Global Investment Banking focuses on building long-term relationships with more than 3,000 large corporations, financial institutions and financial sponsors, by providing strong advisory expertise and capitalizing on powerful M&A, corporate banking, treasury, debt and equity product expertise to deliver integrated financial solutions. We have a significant presence in the Americas, Europe, Emerging Markets (ex-Asia) and Asia Pacific.
We are looking for Summer Interns from a wide range of disciplines with demonstrable energy, drive to succeed and a strong desire to make a difference – is that you?

Summer Analysts in the Asia Pacific region participate in a 9 week program, depending on location, which is designed to give you a unique opportunity to gain exposure to life in Investment Banking. The program begins with firm wide orientation and continues throughout the internship with training, networking events and social activities across the Global business.
As a Summer Analyst within Investment Banking, you will:

Be part of a highly structured and dedicated program with global reach. You will develop technical and soft skills in a fun global team environment and leave us with a holistic understanding of our firm and the people within it
Work on projects alongside bankers in specific industry, product and country coverage groups, providing you with a unique learning opportunity
Help the team deliver solutions to clients leveraging full spectrum of the bank's capabilities
Actively contribute to the preparation of client presentations and underlying financial analysis

Develop a global network. You will learn from, and work with, teams consisting of professionals drawn from across the business, including senior bankers within your group, experts in other areas of the firm and colleagues from around the globe
Build relationships, knowledge and experience that will open doors to a wide range of future career options and opportunities

Unique to Bank of America is our provision of a Chief Resource Officer (CRO). The CRO’s sole purpose is to manage and optimize the junior banker experience on a very hands-on manner. The CRO partners closely with senior leadership to instill the firm’s culture, to ensure work/life balance and to provide a well rounded, fun and value-add experience for junior bankers.

In some countries, Summer Analysts are placed in a generalist team which means a 'staffer' will staff you on projects in specific industry, product and country coverage groups. In other countries, Summer Analysts are placed directly with a specific team throughout the internship. Team placement is determined by considering business needs and the interests/skills of the Summer Analyst.
The various Investment Banking groups span across country, industry and product (not all groups exist in all countries):
Outstanding academic achievement which is complemented by other socioeconomic extracurricular activities
Comfortable with change and adjust to changing demands and requirements
Demonstrates a keen interest in the business you are applying to
Fluency in English is essential, appropriate Asian language skills are also essential for some roles and countries
The 9 week program are designed to help you decide whether our offer matches your aspirations and include:
A dedicated Chief Resource Officer (CRO) who is tasked with managing and optimizing the junior banker experience
An induction and training program with classroom and on the job instruction
Summer Senior Speaker Series, featuring global and divisional presentations by top executives
Formal career support via buddies, CROs, mentors and staffers who will help you navigate through the program
Opportunities to interact with senior bankers and network with peers
Constructive feedback sessions through performance evaluations

The Fines and Enforcement Services (FES) provides end-to-end management of infringement matters to the Victorian Government and a range of external enforcement agencies. The criticality of this function has been elevated following the introduction of Victoria's Fines Reform Act 2014 (the Fines Reform Act), which will transition Victoria to a wholly administrative fines recovery model.

The FES Reform Program aims to provide business stability and continuity for existing FES business services. Simultaneously, the FES Reform Program will prepare the business for the future, including the organisational and technology change required to deliver the Fines Reform Act and any other future services. Under the direction of the Program Director, the FES Reform Program will lead the coordination of a number of interrelated and interdependent projects to implement transformational change across the FES business.

As the Automation Test Analyst, you will drive and control all technical aspects required to design, deliver and maintain an automation framework for the VIEW system. This includes providing strong leadership to ensure all key deliverables and outcomes are met as per the program's scope of works. In the role, you will also:
manage the quality aspects of testing work
provide leadership and guidance to Test Analysts on automation testing status, regression defects, risks and any impacts
develop test schedules, highlighting tasks, dependencies and the deployment of the Test Analysts and Map out the test schedule
identify and communicate risks and issues as they arise and work collaboratively to mitigate or resolve them respectively
influence and manage a diverse stakeholder group to ensure delivery of a coordinated and aligned end product.
Please note this is a full time, fixed term opportunity until 31 December, 2020.
Along with strong project management, written communication and problem solving skills, as our ideal candidate, you will have:
strong test management skills and in-depth knowledge of current testing techniques across the test levels
extensive experience using test automation tools, such as Selenium
ability to write scripts using JAVA
experience in applying testing methods such as risk-based testing, static review techniques, test process efficiency and effectiveness measurements
experience in developing automation for web and API interfaces
test automation design experience for Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery.
A relevant experience as a Automation Test Specialist in a complex ICT environment would be highly desirable

An opportunity to work with purpose! Everyone at UniSuper plays a role in helping Australia’s thinkers, creators and investigators achieve an exceptional retirement. We look after the retirement savings of Australia’s best and brightest, so we want to work with the best and brightest too. We deliver exceptional service to our members, their employers and each other. We are looking for smart people who want to do remarkable things. We strive to create an environment where people enjoy coming to work every day.
The choices we make at work are based on the value it will bring to our members. Check out our website to learn more, www.unisuper.com.au

Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We’re making a difference in the monitoring space, and we’re looking for energetic, talented professionals to grow our team. Your role supports UniSuper by helping to provide reliable, cost effective and efficient monitoring systems that support the effective operation of UniSuper’s technology stack. You will help implement and then operate a completely new monitoring stack, which delivers a clear view of UniSuper’s technology & business systems. It’s an exciting time to join the team!

You will be tasked with offering deep monitoring support for multiple technology stacks, managing vendors, and governing and providing core monitoring services that enables a standardised approach to monitoring. Your communication and stakeholder management will set you up for success as you navigate what best practice looks like, dashboard that provide insightful information and a move to being more proactive than reactive.

To be successful in this role, you should have previous experience of working within the support area of an IT department and experience working with application monitoring alert software. You will have hands on experience administering, maintaining and configuring monitoring platforms and technology. You will have experience with Splunk, Splunk ITSI & Splunk SAI. You will be excited about embracing and identifying new, unchartered opportunities.

This is a genuine growth role and critical to our business. We know you might be nervous in times of uncertainty about applying for a new role. Please rest assured your health and safety is important to us all our staff are currently working from home.

The superannuation is here to stay. We constantly review the health of our fund so you can concentrate on delivering outcomes for our members. Don’t let Covid -19 prevent you from considering this role.

Data insights is growing rapidly and you have the chance to work with people passionate about data. We know a healthy work life is important so talk to us about what flexibility means to you. You will receive the support that you need to build your own career in a team that is leading change and delivery outcomes across UniSuper.

You’ll also receive competitive pay plus generous 17% superannuation contributions, extra annual leave days between Christmas and New Year, access to a Wellness program, volunteer leave, gym discounts and regular social events. You can also access our Financial Advisers at a reduced rate to help you plan your financial future.

The Fines and Enforcement Services (FES) provides end-to-end management of infringement matters to the Victorian Government and a range of external enforcement agencies. The criticality of this function has been elevated following the introduction of Victoria's Fines Reform Act 2014 (the Fines Reform Act), which will transition Victoria to a wholly administrative fines recovery model.

The FES Reform Program aims to provide business stability and continuity for existing FES business services. Simultaneously, the FES Reform Program will prepare the business for the future, including the organisational and technology change required to deliver the Fines Reform Act and any other future services. Under the direction of the Program Director, the FES Reform Program will lead the coordination of a number of interrelated and interdependent projects to implement transformational change across the FES business.

The Operations Support Analyst will provide immediate assistance (by phone) to traders, back office, support personnel and IT staff in an effort to achieve the highest customer satisfaction and minimize the impact of IT related problems. The Operation Support Analyst is not a typical NOC/helpdesk role—it is part of a highly specialized support organization that is responsible for the daily operations of multiple industry leading trading exchanges, clearing systems, and data services. This is a customer-facing position that requires identifying, troubleshooting, and resolving both internal system problems, as well as external customer-related IT issues. The role requires a blend of general technical and business knowledge, as well as a comprehensive understanding of the overall architecture of the ICE/NYSE exchanges, divisions, clearing, and infrastructure. This position is not a Systems Administrator or Network Engineering position
column2: however, prior experience in these areas is desirable. Job level will be determined based on years of relevant experience.

column1: This is a 24x7 environment and the position may require weekend scheduling and or working on other shifts.

Interact with third-party vendors, coordinate and collaborate with various internal business units
Maintain operations and administration of proprietary systems is an integral part of the position
Assist other ICE/NYSE staff with problem solving and escalation procedures
Quickly assess an issue(s) and provide management with well-conceived short and long-term actions for restoration of service(s)
Ownership of production incidents including communication, escalation, and follow-up for root-cause analysis

Control computer system(s) on schedule by means of computer system console, operator checklists, and third-party software

Systems/Application support experience OR Associates/Bachelor’s degree
Ability to be organized and decisive while under pressure, when managing urgent and critical production issues as and when they occur
Team Player - able to interface/liaison effectively with a variety of technical/non-technical contributors throughout the organization
Logical approach, critical thinking and analytical problem-solving skills with the ability to identify the root cause(s) of a problem
Demonstrate reliability, flexibility, and attention to detail

Financial markets, trading and clearing systems
Network and network forensic analysis (packet capture analysis)
Java, Visual Basic, MQ, SWIFT, shell scripting
Ability to debug/write shell scripts. Basic knowledge about Java Coding/Debugging. Ability to look at logs/stack trace to debug issues
Proficiency in Bash, Solaris, Linux, UNIX operating systems
Understanding and working knowledge of TCP/IP, UDP and Multicast technologies

Working knowledge of router, switch, firewall, and proxy technologies: Apache, Akamai (CDN), DNS, LDAP, MySQL

Your role supports UniSuper by helping to provide reliable, cost effective and efficient monitoring systems that support the effective operation of UniSuper’s technology stack. TS supports the DJCS vision of ‘a justice and community safety system that works together to build a safer, fairer and stronger Victoria' through the effective management of technology innovation, value, risk and performance quality.

The role primarily supports the development of and lead the implementation of data architectures aligned with the department's organisation wide enterprise architecture principles and architecture standards to meet highly complex project and business requirements. You will collaborate with business unit staff and business analysts to translate highly complex business requirements into sound designs, and effectively communicate and translate technical concepts to senior stakeholders to enable informed decision-making and the management of expectations.

Significant, up-to-date knowledge and understanding of architecture best practices, as well as, knowledge of new or emerging technologies and their potential value to the organisation.

Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking capabilities. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, we have a global reach with operations in about 50 countries and employ more than 45,000 people from over 150 different nations. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit, Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients, including innovative products and specially tailored advice. Striving for quality and excellence in our work, we recognize and reward extraordinary performance among our employees, provide wide-ranging training and development opportunities, and benefit from a diverse range of perspectives to create value for our clients, shareholders and communities. We are Credit Suisse.
Get your career off to the best start with Credit Suisse
Join the IBCM team in Sydney or Melbourne this Summer to start your investment banking career with Credit Suisse!

We advise companies, private equity firms and asset managers on strategically important acquisitions and divestments and help them access the best sources of capital to support their growth. We are innovative, creative and committed to the success of our clients and our team.
The 11-week IBCM Summer Analyst Program provides excellent exposure to the financial services industry.

Our Summer Analyst work on live deals and gain hands-on experience. As a Summer Analyst you could expect to:Analyze companies using financial modeling and valuation techniques,Examine the impact of a transaction on a client’s capital structure, andThink about the strategy behind a merger or acquisition.

We are focused on your development and will give you regular feedback and have formal check-in points to review your progress. At the end of the Summer, graduate offers are made to interns who we believe will be successful as full-time analysts within the Credit Suisse IBCM team.

Your first week is dedicated to orientation and completing our training program designed specifically for IBCM. During the program we will have sessions with senior bankers to help you learn from experienced professionals about innovative deals that are transforming today's corporate landscape. You'll grow your skills, while putting your career on a fast track.

You will be matched with a buddy who will provide advice and guidance throughout the program and will have opportunities to participate in social, networking and mentoring events that will also help you understand our Equities and Private Banking businesses.

To be eligible for this program you need to be in your penultimate year of an undergraduate or Master’s program, graduating between June and December 2021, and have the right to work in Australia – Australian or New Zealand citizen or permanent resident.

The role primarily supports the development of and lead the implementation of data architectures aligned with the department's organisation wide enterprise architecture principles and architecture standards to meet highly complex project and business requirements. Significant, up-to-date knowledge and understanding of architecture best practices, as well as, knowledge of new or emerging technologies and their potential value to the organisation.

Demonstrated senior experience leading solution architecting large scale contemporary cloud and Software-as-a-Service enabled transformation programmes (using platform technologies such as Microsoft, Salesforce, AWS, etc).

Demonstrated experience in contemporary data architecture and management techniques using SQL/NoSQL/Python/R, advanced integration methods, data visualisation, data quality management, data pipeline automation and Machine Learning.

We believe in always doing the right thing for people and keeping a personal connection, no matter the project size.

Data visualisation and storytelling is the art of analysing disparate data, infusing business logic and crafting outputs to create user-centric best practice. This is done in an intuitive and compelling way.

You'll be tasked with driving understanding and decision making based on this data, from key executives through to operational analysts. You'll help shape business requirements and, in doing so, design, develop and implement visual analytics solutions for our clients.
Using a variety of techniques including data storytelling, Gestalt principles and a user-centric approach, you'll design and develop compelling data visualisations.
Build tailored Tableau, Wave and/or Looker visualisations and define required supporting data architecture (e.g. data marts).
Collaborate with both business and IT partners to identify key use cases and define associated requirements.
Provide thought leadership and standard methodologies required to deliver effective and sustainable solutions.
Significant recent experience in the field of business intelligence information management or consulting.
Outstanding analytical, conceptual and problem-solving abilities.
Highly motivated and able to work independently as well as in a team environment.
Tertiary qualification in Data Science, Data Analytics, Information Management, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field.
Sophisticated knowledge of SQL, including the ability to write stored procedures, triggers, analytic/windowing functions and tuning.
Knowledge of relational and dimensional database structures, theories and practices.

For when life returns to normal, you'll work out of our CBD co-working space, which is extremely well appointed. We believe you'll love the relaxed vibe and variety of break out spaces to support your working style and aid creativity!

column1: Aesop are seeking an experienced and dynamic Senior Business Planning Manager to lead and drive the Business Planning and Analysis function based at Aesop’s Global Head Office in Melbourne.

In this role, critical to Aesop, you will be responsible for working with global head office teams and multiple regional offices across over 23 markets to deliver five-year business plans, annual budgets, and rolling forecasts that align to the strategic principles and vision of Aesop.

You will be a key contact with Aesop’s parent entity, Natura & Co Group, with the group planning team as well as providing key insights and reporting metrics to the Group’s Investor Relations team that ultimately provide external analysts commercial insight.

As a significant leader, you will build and lead a small team to implement, maintain and continuously improve the planning process as well as deliver key analytical insights to the business.Key responsibilities of the role include, but are not limited to –

Business Planning and Forecasting – You’ll be responsible for preparing the annual five-year financial plan, working closely with the strategy team to ensure the financial plan supports the strategic priorities of Aesop and deliver the detailed bottom up annual budget P&L, cash flow and balance sheet which aligns to the five-year plan targets.

Management Reporting and Analysis – You’ll be responsible for preparing regular and ad-hoc analysis of performance against business plans with analysis of drivers of each short- and long-term target, as well as providing quarterly management reporting to Natura & Co Group, as well as Aesop monthly management reporting.

Communication and Leadership – You’ll lead and develop a small business planning team providing coaching, feedback and effective performance management. You’ll also act as Aesop’s key point of contact with Natura & Co’s PF&A and Investor relations teams to provide information around operating performance, quarterly forecasting and key metrics such as like for like growth, store numbers, ROIC, free cash flow and Capex spend.

Strategic Partnerships - You’ll develop strong relationships and regular communication with key Regional Commercial leaders and Head Office and the internal Project Management Office (PMO) to stay abreast of current trading conditions and status of current and planned initiatives and projects. You’ll also form close relationships with the Strategy team to align planning to the strategic principles of the business, as well as the Sustainability team to support the measurement and reporting of KPIs to continue to advance our Triple Bottom Line reporting.
Tertiary qualification in Commerce, Finance, Accounting or related field
8+ years’ experience in a similar position

column2: Strong commercial acumen and advanced understanding of financial metrics and financial statements
The ability to lead and influence others to collectively achieve desired outcomes within the dynamics of a matrix organisation is essential to this role

column1: Able to quickly develop a strong understanding of the key people and business drivers within any business
Strong modelling background combined with ability to deliver planning tools, processes and systems which are robust and scalable
Exceptional stakeholder engagement and ability to develop trust and relationships across a wide range of constituents and diverse audiences
Experience working across multiple international markets
Experience in Retail or FMCG highly regarded
Ability to work effectively in times of ambiguity.

This critical role presents an opportunity to directly impact the future growth of Aesop and the parent group. Aesop provides a supportive and stimulating working environment and a commitment to developing our employees at all levels. If you are looking for the opportunity to evolve your career to the next level with a progressive and entrepreneurial Australian business, then we would love to hear from you.

The TS Application Developer designs, develops, maintains and administers software solutions which translates business requirements into technology terms. They take responsibility for the production of solutions in line with business requirements and specifications. They are responsible for the development of the specific platform by prototyping, implementing, deployment and supporting the customisation or configuration in line with change requests, new services introduction and/or evolving business rules or requirements.

TS Application Developers work closely with the Business Analysts and receive detailed business / user requirement specifications that identify the goal of the program and use this to assist with the preparation of a functional requirements document, including context and system flowcharts that diagrammatically show how the information will flow through the computer and its peripheral or related equipment. They analyse the business requirements and ensure that the designed solution meets these requirements. He/she meets with internal clients, Business Analysts and/or designers to understand the project scope before writing the code.Design the application

They are responsible for writing step-by-step instructions that direct computers to process information and are required to work on a wide range of projects with medium complexity. They design the logic that delivers the computing system functionality. The TS Application Developer takes responsibility for documenting the code that he/she has written into a process that enables application use and security. These individuals transform the detailed requirements into a complete, detailed systems design document which focuses on how to deliver the required functionality.

The TS Application Developer converts a design into a complete information system including acquiring and installing the systems environment, creating and testing databases, preparing test case procedures, preparing test files, coding, compiling, refining programs and performing test readiness review and procurement activities.

Once the application has been designed, the TS Application Developer tests the program prior to its deployment and release. If the test does not deliver the required results, the TS Application Developer examines the program errors in logic and data and makes the necessary corrections and if required, escalates the problem to the Technical Team Lead. In so doing, they perform debugging and data resolution activities.

The TS Application Developer works with technical teams to assist with the installation and deployment of the application. This includes implementation preparation, implementation of the solution into a production environment and resolution of any problems identified in the integration and test phases.

These individuals are required to write and distribute the task descriptions in a production environment to operate and maintain the solution they have designed and implemented. This includes post implementation and in process reviews.

TS Application Developers are able to work with abstract concepts and have sound problem solving and analytical skills. They are able to communicate effectively with a variety of stakeholders, including the technical teams and clients. They demonstrate good attention to detail and work well within a team environment. They display strong client service orientation and strive for client engagement
What will make you a good fit for the role?
SharePoint Online development experience (including CSOM/JSOM/REST and Graph API)
Azure development experience with Functions, Webhooks, WebAPI

The Information Technology unit of the Department of Parliamentary Services is seeking an experienced and motivated candidate for the role of Test Lead and Business Analyst. This is a fixed term role, up to 12 months in duration with the possibility of extension.

You will be joining our Website Redevelopment Project which is working to modernise Parliament's public website (www.parliament.vic.gov.au). In this role you will be responsible for establishing and overseeing the test methodology and toolset that will ensure that Parliament's website development meets quality standards and is delivered to user needs.

You will also be responsible for working with internal and external stakeholders to gather requirements and develop user stories, define specifications and determine acceptance criteria for web development activities.

To succeed in this role, you must be able to demonstrate experience working in a digital test role and in the establishment of comprehensive website test processes including the capacity to deliver a test strategy that includes both automated and manual approaches.

You should have a solid understanding of how to use frameworks and design patterns to effectively manage code and assets and demonstrated experience utilising tools such as DevOps / TFS for test planning, execution and defect management.
You must be able to work in a fast-paced project team working in an agile manner. Your personal skills will include the ability to engage with a diverse range of stakeholders

The Senior Cyber Defence Analyst is a technical leadership role, responsible for providing specialist capabilities to the Cyber Defence team.
The primary focus of this role will be mentoring the Cyber Defence team and delivering Cyber Security threat identification, detection, response and assisting with threat intelligence services.

In this role, the Senior Cyber Defence Analyst will provide thought leadership and coaching to Cyber Analysts while providing support and subject matter expertise to support Cyber Defence Team Lead and the National Manager Cyber Defence. You will engage with the wider Security Group and provide technical expertise when and where required to improve security monitoring of nbn assets.

Your communication skills will be top rated to converse with technical leads from other areas of nbn including, networks, infrastructure and application platforms. In this highly skilled role, the Senior Cyber Defence Analyst’s will be the technical subject matter expert (SME) with responsibility of using security systems and toolset, managing all aspects of threat management and work closely with the Cyber Incident Response team to respond to threats, including understanding and reporting their impact.
Integrating internal and external threat intelligence into threat management tools and identifying opportunities or taking the lead to automate manual task is required.
This role will involve being on call on a rotational basis and will require active participation during an incident.

The Senior Cyber Defence Analyst will have a minimum of 5 years’ experience working in a Security Operations Centres or similarly, high volume environment with a desire to proactively improve security monitoring processes and tools by presenting innovative ideas or new ways of operating current toolsets to mature Cyber Defence capabilities.
We are looking for a particularly skilled Senior Cyber Defence Analyst in Security event and incident management tools and other supporting network, endpoint and cloud security monitoring tools.

You will be a Technical leader with the ability to utilise advanced techniques to analyse and detect the presence of malicious activity, with a solid understanding and practical use of threat management frameworks and hunting.
To be successful in this role, the Senior Cyber Defence Analyst will have extensive experience in the following:
Operational Cyber Security Experience including Threat Hunting
Specialist skills in Cyber Security tools such as Cisco Security Tool Suite and Splunk
Practical working knowledge of current and recent tactics techniques and procedures for common attack types, including frameworks such as: Kill Chain and Mitre Attack framework
Experience with Cyber Security Incident response
Experience with threat management tools and incident response platform
Experience with network security monitoring platforms
Experience using Security incident and event management (SIEM) tools
Web and email policy management platforms
Experience with end point security and malware protection capabilities
Any Cyber Security certifications would be highly desirable

Australia-VIC-Melbourne | Full-time (FT) | Private Banking and Wealth Management | Job ID 149890

Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking capabilities. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, we have a global reach with operations in about 50 countries and employ more than 45,000 people from over 150 different nations. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit, Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients, including innovative products and specially tailored advice. Striving for quality and excellence in our work, we recognize and reward extraordinary performance among our employees, provide wide-ranging training and development opportunities, and benefit from a diverse range of perspectives to create value for our clients, shareholders and communities. We are Credit Suisse.

Credit Suisse’s Private Banking focusses on delivering comprehensive advice, investment products and wealth management solutions for High-Net-Worth and Ultra-High-Net-Worth Individuals (e.g., entrepreneurs, self-funded retirees or wealthy families).

The key area of Private Banking advises clients on the optimal asset allocation designed to protect and grow their wealth. It seeks to develop long term, relationship driven annuity business by providing a broad range of investment products and services tailored to clients’ complex needs. The approach is delivered through the integrated One Bank platform, which provides clients with the deep understanding of the Private Banking department as well as access to advisory services and other products offered through the Investment Banking departments. This enables us to provide these individuals with many of the same resources and services offered to the bank’s largest and most sophisticated institutional investors. With over a century and a half of banking innovation, Credit Suisse has the advantage of being a truly integrated bank with a Swiss heritage.

Our Private Banking Summer Analyst Program is an 11-week program designed to give students a taster of life at the world’s leading Wealth Manager, with the potential to join the Graduate Program upon graduation. The graduate role will rotate through the core Private Banking business functions for a period of 24-months. Working towards becoming an Assistant Relationship Manager (ARM) and then a Relationship Manager (RM) further down the career path. Roles are also available across Investment Consulting and Discretionary Portfolio Management.
Credit Suisse prides itself in a tradition of long term partnership with our clients, putting advice at the core of all that we do and flawless teamwork for the benefit of the client.
Positions are available in Sydney and Melbourne.

Our training is widely regarded as one of the best and most comprehensive summer programs. Gain exposure in Client Relationship Management, Investment Consulting, Discretionary Portfolio Management, Business Development or operational aspects of the business through rotation and receive invaluable on-the-job training and mentorship that will further improve your skills and knowledge.

Credit Suisse is noted for the diversity of its employees, but seeks candidates with a common set of abilities. We are looking for highly motivated and creative individuals who have demonstrated academic achievement. We seek to build future leaders who add fresh perspectives to our business.

Whatever your background, you’ll need to be:In your penultimate year of an undergraduate or Master’s program, graduating between June and December 2021Have the right to work in Australia – Australian or New Zealand citizen or permanent resident.A leader who engenders dedication, assumes responsibility and mobilizes others.A critical thinker with excellent analytical skills.An enthusiastic self-starter who achieves significant results.An encouraging and adaptable team member who can build strong relationships.An articulate communicator who also recognizes the importance of listening.Principled and committed to the highest standards of ethical behavior
You will need to complete an application on the Credit Suisse website – www.credit-suisse.com/careers – for consideration.

Eligible candidates will be asked to take online numerical and verbal reasoning tests as part of your application. Please complete the tests in 2 days. It should take you no more than 40 minutes to do the tests. We will only review the rest of the application once you have completed this step and test scores are submitted successfully.
Melbourne Office: Tuesday, July 14 at 12:00 noon AEST
Sydney Office: Tuesday, July 28 at 12:00 noon AEST

Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities:
Daily leadership and development of a small, embedded QA team for end-to-end QA on AAA game titles.
Actively assess and communicate the needs or progress of development partners, and how they relate to the QA team’s priorities and tasks.

Experience leading team projects with milestone deliverable tracking, status reports, and signoffs.
Experience with game and software development tools (e.g. Maya, C++, Radiant, Unreal, Perforce, etc.).

3+ released game titles in a leadership role within QA.

Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. The CSM will own the creation, development, and execution of the strategic project plan for a portfolio of accounts for our platform and Managed Marketplaces Services. Financial success Client Retention Adoption of new features and initiatives
Understanding the client’s goals across their marketplaces channels and developing strategic plan to drive results to achieve those goals.

Prior expertise working in a technical, client facing role.
Comfort level in a fast-paced, team environment with the ability to leverage data to make important decisions.
Experience working in high-pressure situations with demonstrated effectiveness in managing client dispute and risk situations.
Superior written and verbal communication skills and outstanding presentation abilities.

IBM Research/Data Scientist - Health AI, Image Analytics

We are seeking a highly motivated and passionate researcher to join our AI for Health team. Our mission is to develop Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies to help deliver top quality health care while mitigating the spiralling costs of the health care system. In order to make this a reality, we develop AI and advanced machine learning methodologies in collaboration with clinical researchers. We are seeking a proactive, enthusiastic researcher to contribute to our AI applications for health assessment and disease management. The candidate will dynamically work across disciplines and geographies to contribute towards developing the transformational ideas that will have impact on the world.Job responsibilities

You will work with a team of established researchers to generate new ideas and will be expected to implement and communicate these ideas through software demos as well as scientific publications conference presentations, and contribute to IBM’s patent portfolio. You will contribute to the team strategy also supervise postdoctoral researchers and interns. Researchers have the opportunities to network not only with local colleagues but also have access to a global network of eminent, passionate and approachable researchers only too willing to share their knowledge. You will also have the opportunity to explore all IBM has to offer throughout the whole research-development-delivery pipeline.Required expertise
Extensive knowledge and at least two years hands-on experience of computer vision, machine learning and deep learning for analysing multimodal data, in particular images.
Domain knowledge in healthcare life sciences would be a great add-on.
Expert level programming skills in Python and/or other programming languages.
Software maintenance and source control (such as Git).
Academic output documented via journal/conference publications in the field.
A Doctorate degree in computer science or related field.

The Manager, Sales Support will be responsible for developing quotations for sales reps in accordance with pricing, legal and financial standards and guidance from sales.

This position is also responsible for managing the other members of the quotes team across Asia Pacific & Japan (APJ) including team performance management to service level agreements and system compliance requirements. This includes managing and participating in projects, on-going initiatives and working collaboratively with Analysts from process, system, analytics and operational teams in diagnosing, designing and deploying continuous improvement initiatives related to quoting and sales support activities.

The ideal candidate should be excited to be working with colleagues across Asia, and be capable of adjusting to differing cultural nuances and business conditions. This will also extend to working and aligning with the global Illumina Commercial Operations teams to represent APJ requirements and align with global standards.

The ideal candidate is perceptive and capable of identifying actions or processes that are against the best interests of the company and be capable of taking appropriate action to escalate and correct the issue where appropriate. They must also be able to readily adapt to changing needs of our customers and sales team, and deploy adjustments to our processes as required.

Provides quotes to sales team or field service upon request (e.g., standard, custom, billable quotes) based on product specifications, pricing, and discount levels according to global and APJ pricing strategy and discounting policies.

Is proficient in the details of the Illumina Pricing and related policies and is able to advise others on key aspects of these policies. Supports Sales personnel on pricing, approval, and quotes related inquiries.
Reviews terms and conditions for adherence to internal policies.
Ensures all administrative tasks associated with deal or contract closing are carried out in collaboration with key stakeholders.
Plans and leads periodic contract (e.g., ‘Annual Standing Agreement’) renewal process.
Executes pricing changes with Sales or Service team using Pricing Centre of Excellence framework.
Triggers escalations appropriately and seeks approvals for non-standard business cases.
Supports the compliance and performance efficiencies of the APJ quotes team in the following:
Supervise the Quotes team to provide timely day-to-day sales support to sales team / channel team / field service / customers, etc.

Monitor quotations issued by quotes and sales team to ensure compliance with global and APJ pricing strategy and discounting policies. Conduct random Audits on quotes to ensure proper process are followed
Meet SOX/ISO/audit compliance and quality requirements and ensure rest of the team is doing so as well.

Identify and resolve customer satisfaction and operational issues proactively by engaging cross-functionally at varying levels to seek appropriate solutions to meet internal and business partners’ requirements.
Work with management to define and execute regional discounting policies and drive consistency in pricing among accounts.
Work with global pricing team and systems team to validate pricing changes at the regional level.
Manage the Quotes team in terms of workload, performance, risk mitigation, staffing and training to make sure there is appropriate support for the service level agreement.

Analyze data on trends in quotes generated (volume, products, source, etc.) and other areas of sales administrative support. Provide recommendations to resolve problems or improve business processes. Investigate recurring quote errors and conduct post-mortum reviews to provide recommendations for process improvements where needed in Configure Price Quote (CPQ) activities.
Participate in projects involving process improvements, new business process rollout, and new system implementations, including beta-testing and providing feedback on pre-launch sales admin tools.
Work with teams from global and other regions to align processes and share and adopt best practices around system usage.
Support the quotation team around policy and work to streamline policy around quotations.
Lead the team in conducting quote-related trainings to commercial teams and sales channel partners (distributors)
column2: Assist with sales team processes including staff onboarding / off-boarding.

column1: Continuously support the field to ensure best practices are maintained around creating quotations.
Provide backup to other quotation team members as needed. Provide 2nd level approval for high-value quotes.

Ensure the sales support team is customer focused (through the sales team) and strive for improvements in process, technology, systems and resource deployment to always meet this objective. Align with the success of the sales team in meeting customer needs and driving revenue.
All listed tasks and responsibilities are deemed as essential functions to this position
column2: however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities.

column1: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required. Business or Technical field preferred. Life sciences degree a plus.
Successful track record in sales, sales operations, customer service or a related commercial support role preferred.
7+ years of direct work experience, with 2+ years of Management experience.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English. Knowledge of another Asian language is useful, Mandarin, Japanese or Korean being most in demand.
Strong attention to detail and commitment to deliver quality work in a timely manner.
Demonstrated ability to multi-task, work in team settings, and work independently when required.
Strong analytical, organizational, problem solving and project management skills.
Understands Go-To-Market strategy principles, key customer engagement processes and utilization of key business metrics to enable data-driven decision making.

Possess an open, flexible, and positive can-do attitude with good communication, interpersonal skills and the ability to work well with multiple departments to execute mutually beneficial solutions. Experience dealing with difficult internal and external situations.

Thorough knowledge of Microsoft Office and Outlook and possess an innate ability to navigate through new software applications. Software, especially web-based software, shouldn’t scare the ideal candidate. Experience with SAP and Salesforce.com a plus.

Illumina believes that everyone has the ability to make an impact, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship status, and genetic information.

As we transform into a platform-based company, we need to assess any opportunities we pursue against risk. In this, you’ll be the voice of reason across all projects and processes when it comes to identifying and assessing Fraud risks.
As the Risk Manager- Fraud Assessment, you’ll:
Support and Lead a specialised analyst to identify fraud risks within the business
Champion different thinking on how fraud risk influences new products/ processes, accelerated growth and the transformation of our company to a platform-led business.
Consult and influence stakeholders in fraud risk management, empowering them to manage risk themselves
Develop, implement, and monitor performance & quality metrics across Operational Teams within Fraud.
Manage and Optimise the strategy to mitigate against Internal fraud.
Lead the design, implementation and monitoring of an overarching fraud framework that are aligned with the organisation’s fraud risk appetite.

This is a fast-changing environment. In other words, where you thrive most. We’re looking for someone that can manage a varied workload with the ability to prioritise projects and BAU activities with that of Fraud, business and core functional objectives. You’ll also:
Be clued-up about all things finance (including regulation)
Be a subject matter expert in Fraud and project experience preferably in a risk assessment capacity
Understanding of fraud and cyber-crime environment to influence business strategy decisions
Strong P&L focus, with the ability to think operationally and implement projects providing a P&L impact.
Have an Agile frame of mind. This one’s a must.
Have a strong history of building stakeholder relationships
Be an excellent presenter with consulting and negotiation skills at Executive levels

That’s a good sign. In return for your energy and ideas, we’re able to offer you a competitive salary, genuinely flexible work hours (adjusted days, hours, work from home), annual leave perks and a health and wellbeing program that helps you feel your best. Interested? Let’s talk.

In the pinstriped world of finance, we’re a refreshing change. Yes we work with credit cards, loans and digital payments - but what we really do is help people from all walks of life shop and live better.
As we open up this new world of payments, we’re taking our customers with us – and we need people as ambitious as we are to be part of this amazing wave.

Latitude’s number one priority is to ensure your safety and the safety of our workplace, this is our commitment. With an increasingly dispersed workforce – most of us are now working remotely and will be conducting all our interviews via Zoom or Skype. If you have ANY questions or concerns, please bring them up during the screening process, we’re here to help you put your best foot forward. – Latitude Talent Team

198,197,"Business Analyst","Web Test Lead","Melbourne VIC","Victorian Government","None","None","6 days ago","https://www.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=78cae6007e8b4f5c&fccid=1818d10a60db56b4&vjs=3","

The Parliament of Victoria through its elected representatives is accountable to the Victorian Community for the provision and conduct of representative government in the interests of all Victorians. The objectives of the Departments of the Parliament is to deliver apolitical, professional and innovative services to support our elected representatives and the Parliament as an institution. Through our commitment to diversity and equality, we are actively engaged in promoting and maintaining a safe and inclusive work environment where all employees are respected, valued and supported. Our employees are the key to our success and bring new and innovative responses to issues and challenges we face in our work in the delivery of quality services to support the work of the Parliament.

The Information Technology unit of the Department of Parliamentary Services is seeking an experienced and motivated candidate for the role of Test Lead and Business Analyst. This is a fixed term role, up to 12 months in duration with the possibility of extension.

You will be joining our Website Redevelopment Project which is working to modernise Parliament's public website (www.parliament.vic.gov.au). In this role you will be responsible for establishing and overseeing the test methodology and toolset that will ensure that Parliament's website development meets quality standards and is delivered to user needs.

You will also be responsible for working with internal and external stakeholders to gather requirements and develop user stories, define specifications and determine acceptance criteria for web development activities.

To succeed in this role, you must be able to demonstrate experience working in a digital test role and in the establishment of comprehensive website test processes including the capacity to deliver a test strategy that includes both automated and manual approaches.

You should have a solid understanding of how to use frameworks and design patterns to effectively manage code and assets and demonstrated experience utilising tools such as DevOps / TFS for test planning, execution and defect management.
You must be able to work in a fast-paced project team working in an agile manner. Your personal skills will include the ability to engage with a diverse range of stakeholders
column2: this will be reflected in your approach to engagement and reporting.

column1: Experience with Selenium and an understanding the principles of test driven development, continuous integration, continuous delivery, GUI and API test automation would be highly regarded.

Whether you're working in the iconic heritage listed Parliament House building or in our adjacent open-plan, modern offices you'll have easy access to public transport, Melbourne's top retailers, cafes and restaurants, along with other lifestyle attractions available on the unique Collins Street and Spring Street precincts.

The Parliament of Victoria is committed to providing employees with flexible working conditions to support our employees in balancing their work and life commitments. You may also be eligible for annual discounts on various personal utilities, including myki pass and private health insurance.
Your professional development is important to us, that's why we have a dedicated learning and development framework, along with leadership development programs and targeted in-house training.
When you excel at your work and initiate innovative solutions or go above and beyond to demonstrate our values, you will be recognised for your efforts through our reward and recognition program.

Using the ""Apply Now"" button, please include your resume and brief cover letter (1-2 pages) broadly outlining your experience in line with the Key Selection Criteria contained within the position description.

Klip Sports is the world’s first sports marketing cloud. We are redefining ways rights holders engage fans and helping both brands and rights holders understand the value of digital content sponsorships. The business has three core offerings

Using artificial intelligence and machine learning our content publishing software can automatically detect when a highlight has happened, edit it, cut it and publish to any digital channel. Brand integration and sponsor overlays can be applied in real time prior to publishing. Rights holders can manage all their digital video publishing business by using the full editing suite whilst also using feature like in browser animation creator and our media library.
Our analytics platform helps brands and rights holders understand the value of their digital sponsorship assets.

It can track web content, any social content and provide a full 360 view of sponsorship and content performance online with over 30 dashboards.

To accompany our analytics product, we offer a bespoke reporting and insights service to expand the value of sponsorships and provide the true value of digital and social media channels in sponsorship. Our insights teams use our proprietary valuation approach called DAI (Digital Asset Index) to provide a true representation of value that digital channels deliver for sponsorships.

We are looking for a seasoned analytics professional with experience in master data environments and proven leadership abilities to lead our Asia Pacific & Japan (APJ) Data & Analytics group.
