We are looking for an experienced and highly capable Project Reporting Officer to join our government client who has a significant public impact and is currently going through a comprehensive rebuild of their ICT systems, processes and applications focused on addressing security risks to secure and strengthen all elements of their operating environment.
The Project Reporting Officer will help to plan and manage all aspects of the program and project reporting including budgeting, forecasting and variance analysis.
The successful applicant will be required to undergo a security clearance process and Australian Citizenship is mandatory to be considered for this role.
Monitor and report the progress of program and project expenditure, investigate variances, and review and analyse expenditure items for forty plus projects.
Maintain the data integrity of the budgets, forecasts and planned expenditure in SAP.
Liaise with Project Managers and principals in charge, regarding contract documents, milestone payments and charge orders.
Prepare and present variance reports and reporting submissions as required to management.
Assist the project managers to analyse financial information to identify opportunities/risk and recommending strategies.
Assist with the preparation of budgeting, reporting and forecasting reporting and processes. Evaluate transaction data, identify trends and act on findings to improve data integrity.
Establish and maintain effective and productive working relationships with staff at all levels across the Bureau including senior Group and Program staff
Detailed program financial management experience (Comprising of over 20 projects)
Proven project reporting and analyst capabilities
Strong experience with Microsoft Office Suite (Especially Excel functions and formula)
Advanced experience using Information management systems to extract financial reports, monitor financial activities and process transactions (Experience using SAP highly regarded)
This is an initial 12 month contract, with chance to extend beyond that.
To find out more about this role, please click ‘Apply’
Job Industries: Public Sector and Government
Job Locations: Melbourne CBD, Melbourne, Australia
Why join the Data & Analytics team at Equifax?

Equifax employs 10,000+ employees across 24 countries/1,600 employees in Australia and 82 are employed in our D&A teams here. Equifax uses data, analytics and technology to provide first-class products for its customers. One billion consumers and over ninety million business customers worldwide rely on Equifax to organise, assimilate and analyse data.
Fabulous opportunities to work with some of our largest blue-chip customers across Australia
Chance to use cutting-edge statistical/modelling tools across literally hundreds of data assets
Collaborate & learn from some of the best data minds in Australia who are passionate about all things data and analytics
Attend relevant seminars, participate in hackathons & gain exposure across all phases of the data and analytics lifecycle

Equifax is also recognised as one of the three largest credit agencies in the world. Equifax has grown from a consumer credit company into a leading provider of insights that helps its customers make more informed decisions.

The Data Scientist will hold a senior role within the Data Science team. The main responsibility of the Data Scientist is to deliver innovative decision science models & attributes that leverage Equifax’s vast data assets. These include decision areas covering the credit lifecycle, geodemographic & marketing attributes, ratings & fraud models, as well as any new areas where data driven decision making can be informed by predictive modelling.

Project management, defining business and technical requirements, resource planning and analytic solution design and innovation in a big data environment, as well quality control of analytical output.
Ideally, you’ll have experience within risk management, credit scorecard development, marketing analytics or fraud modelling.
So, what will impress us for the Data Scientist position?
5+ years experience in a similar role (as described above)
Qualification in Mathematics or Statistics. Alternatively, analytics, data science, econometrics or computer science preferred
Experience working on cloud platforms would be advantageous
Experienced using SQL, R, Python & Tableau desired
Background in financial services, telecommunications, utilities or retail favourable (not essential)
Other than offering a very competitive salary here are just a few of the other benefits we offer:
Work/life balance & flexibility, employees consistently rate this category as 'five stars'
Curated learning opportunities available through Equifax's online training portal. We will also fully support further educational opportunities on a case by case basis
Income Protection Insurance, benefit payment for up to 75% of salary up to two years
Structured onboarding/induction training for new employees
You are eligible for a paid day off for your birthday, paid floating day and a paid volunteer day
Final Friday of every month we facilitate a companywide gathering/celebration (drinks/canapes)
Company sponsored events/access to corporate boxes
Multiple local and international career opportunities given our 10,000+ employees in 24 countries. Offices in London, New York, Paris, Atlanta & Dublin to name just a few
Referral reward - successfully refer a new employee and receive between $1,500-$6,000
Employee Assistance Program - Free counselling services

Opportunity to influence large scale data transformations

Be a part of how we help companies utilise their valuable data resources through effective use of data science and machine learning solutions backed by a clear vision and strong executive sponsorship.

Big data, information and analytics. Three words that spark apprehension in most businesses. But our team of experts are constantly curious and excited about combining our wonderful array of technological expertise to transform data into our clients’ most valuable assets, making their work smarter.

We primarily seek to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of organisations at all stages of the data transformation journey from designing the change required, to delivering and managing that change and providing assurance around change initiatives.

As a Data Science Manager, you will be an integral part of one of the fastest growing teams in Australia and you will be responsible for running a work stream on client team engagements and contributing to solutions in areas such as Advanced Visualisation, Machine Learning, Risk Analytics, Real-Time Decisioning, Content Analytics and Guided Actions.
What will your typical day look like?

At Cantel, preventing infection is our business. As a leading provider of infection prevention products and services in the healthcare market, we are dedicated to delivering high-quality, innovative solutions that improve outcomes and help save lives. We accomplish this mission by delivering our products through the following operating units:

Medical: Endoscopy procedure disposables include single-use valves and irrigation tubing. The medical device reprocessing systems, disinfectants, detergents we manufacture and distribute are used to disinfect high-level endoscopes.

Life Sciences: Water purification systems for dialysis facilities. We work with leading dialysis caregivers, delivering hemodialysis dialyzers and reprocessing systems, as well as sterilants and filtration products.

Dental: Single-use, infection prevention products used primarily in the dental market (face masks, sterilization pouches, towels and bibs, tray covers, saliva ejectors, germicidal wipes, plastic cups and disinfectants).

Cantel employees are inspired to improve the lives of patients, caregivers and healthcare providers. If you are looking for a company driven by an entrepreneurial spirit and have the passion to shape the future of infection prevention, we want to meet you. Join us and see why people love working here.

About the role:The Quality Assurance Specialist supports Cantel Australia and APAC teams’ operations and quality system by completing day-to-day Quality Assurance tasks to ensure substantial ISO 13485 compliance as it relates to the Cantel Australia value stream. Manage complaint handling process for product complaints reported to Cantel Australia and APAC teams, resolve quality related issues, manage Quality Assurance metrics, and provide feedback to the Cantel corporate Quality Assurance team. Utilise the Correction and Preventive Action system to pursue continuous improvement of the Quality System and Cantel products.What you will do:Work cross-functionally with Cantel Australia and APAC teams and Cantel Quality Assurance department to ensure clear communication and completion of business and departmental objectives.Work with Cantel International Quality Assurance Manager and Cantel cross-functional departments to assure the ISO 13485 quality system operates in compliance with applicable regulatory standards, including participation in internal and external audits/inspections.Development/ maintenance of local quality system processes, ISO/customer audit facilitation, document control (ISO 13485 and 9001).Implementation of improved/automated QS processes (propel QMS/COMET).Arrange/ Deliver Quality Management Systems (QMS) Procedure training.Manage Cantel complaint handling system by receiving, logging and appropriately reporting customer complaints per the applicable complaint handling systems and processes through to closing.Complaint intake, organization, communication and local QMS documentation/closureComplete Return Merchandise Authorisation (RMA) coordination.Complete quality investigation of complaints.Utilise CAPA system, including issuance of CAPAs, tracking of open CAPAs, and reporting on CAPA effectiveness.Lead Cantel APAC team members to maintain ISO 13485 certification and others as applicable.Facilitate a teamwork atmosphere to urgently resolve quality issues when they arise.Update job knowledge by keeping abreast of trends and developments in quality assurance, ISO 13485 quality systems, and participating in educational opportunities.Where necessary, gather and trend quality data for monthly review and Quality Management Reviews.Supplier management.Manage Local Environmental, Health, and Safety (EHS) matters.Participate on company-wide project teams to provide Quality Assurance input as assigned.Evaluate opportunities for improvements to the operation of the QA department.

What we are looking for:BA or BS degree required, Diploma holder in Life Sciences or Bioengineering1-2 years Quality Assurance experience in a regulated medical device environment, specifically in managing customer complaint handling systemsExperience in responsibility for compliance to FDA and/ or ISO regulations
Previous work experience in life science products or medical device fields is preferredProficient in computer skills such as MS office programs.
